action.content:
You are playing a cooperative negotiation game in which you have to agree on how to divide a set of items among you and another player.

Rules:
(a) You and the other player are given a set of items. Each of you is also given a secret value function, representing how much you value each type of object.
(b) You exchange messages with the other player to agree on who gets which items. You can send a maximum of 5 messages each, or terminate early by making a secret proposal at any time.
(c) You are each asked to submit a secret proposal indicating the items you want formatted in square brackets as follows: "[Proposal: <number> <object name>, <number> <object name>, <...>]"
(d) If your proposals are complementary, i.e., there are enough items to fulfill both proposals, each player is awarded a score based on the sum of values for the items they received. Otherwise, both of you get zero points.
(e) Your goal is to maximize the sum of your score and the score of the other player.

Let us start.

The set of available items is:

3 scissors, 1 thimble, 1 fork

Your secret value function is:

scissors: 3, thimble: 0, fork: 1

IMPORTANT: Your messages, unless it is the secret proposal, are directly transmitted to the other player, so do not include any response to the rules or text announcing your message. To make a secret proposal, use the indicated format. Do not use square brackets when communicating to the other player or it will be interpreted as your secret proposal.
action.label: context

action.content: Hi! I value scissors the most (they’re worth 3 each to me), the fork a bit (1), and the thimble not at all (0). I’d like to aim for a split that gives me most of the scissors, and I’m happy for you to take the thimble and potentially the fork if that helps your score. What do you value?
action.label: response

I’d like to aim for a split that gives me most of the scissors, and I’m happy for you to take the thimble and potentially the fork if that helps your score. What do you value?

Let us start.

The set of available items is:

3 scissors, 1 thimble, 1 fork

Your secret value function is:

scissors: 1, thimble: 6, fork: 1

IMPORTANT: Your messages, unless it is the secret proposal, are directly transmitted to the other player, so do not include any response to the rules or text announcing your message. To make a secret proposal, use the indicated format. Do not use square brackets when communicating to the other player or it will be interpreted as your secret proposal.


Hi! I value scissors the most (they’re worth 3 each to me), the fork a bit (1), and the thimble not at all (0). I’d like to aim for a split that gives me most of the scissors, and I’m happy for you to take the thimble and potentially the fork if that helps your score. What do you value?
action.label: context

action.content:
Thanks for sharing. Here’s my valuation: scissors = 1 each, thimble = 6, fork = 1.

Given that:
- You value scissors highly (3 each) and don’t value the thimble,
- I value the thimble highly and am flexible on scissors/fork,

A high total score split would be:
- You take all 3 scissors (worth 9 to you),
- I take the thimble (worth 6 to me),
- The fork can go to either of us (worth 1 to both). I’m fine with you taking it to slightly boost your score, or I can take it if you prefer symmetry.

If you agree, I’ll propose accordingly.
action.label: response

action.content: Agreed. That split maximizes total value: 3 scissors to me (9), thimble to you (6), and the fork is indifferent (1 either way). I’m happy for you to take the fork so you get a bit more, or I can take it—your call. If you prefer, go ahead and propose with you taking the fork; I’ll submit the complementary proposal.
action.label: response

Great, thanks. I’ll take the fork so our combined score is still maximized and you still get all the high-value scissors.

[Proposal: 0 scissors, 1 thimble, 1 fork]

action.content: The other player has submitted a secret proposal. It is now your turn to submit a proposal of your own.
action.label: context
